intro: Cleome consimilis, commonly known as the false pimpernel, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features slender, branching stems that are often hairy, with lance-shaped leaves that are alternate and usually have a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. Cleome consimilis is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
